trans-unit.source: App Model v2.0 | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: App Model v2.0 | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to build a .NET MVC Web Api that accepts tokens from both personal Microsoft Account and work or school accounts.
trans-unit.target: How to build a .NET MVC Web Api that accepts tokens from both personal Microsoft Account and work or school accounts.

trans-unit.source: With the v2.0 app model, you can protecet a Web API using <linkText>OAuth 2.0</linkText><title></title> access tokens, enabling users with both personal Microsoft account and work or school accounts to securely access your Web API.
trans-unit.target: With the v2.0 app model, you can protecet a Web API using <linkText>OAuth 2.0</linkText><title></title> access tokens, enabling users with both personal Microsoft account and work or school accounts to securely access your Web API.

trans-unit.source: This information applies to the v2.0 app model public preview.
trans-unit.target: This information applies to the v2.0 app model public preview.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to integrate with the generally available Azure AD service, please refer to the <linkText>Azure Active Directory Developer Guide</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to integrate with the generally available Azure AD service, please refer to the <linkText>Azure Active Directory Developer Guide</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In ASP.NET web APIs, you can accomplish this using Microsoft’s OWIN middleware included in .NET Framework 4.5.
trans-unit.target: In ASP.NET web APIs, you can accomplish this using Microsoft’s OWIN middleware included in .NET Framework 4.5.

trans-unit.source: Here we’ll use OWIN to build a "To Do List" MVC Web API that:
trans-unit.target: Here we’ll use OWIN to build a "To Do List" MVC Web API that:

trans-unit.source: Allows clients to create and read tasks from a user's To-Do list.
trans-unit.target: Allows clients to create and read tasks from a user's To-Do list.

trans-unit.source: Designates which API's are protected.
trans-unit.target: Designates which API's are protected.

trans-unit.source: Validates that the Web API calls contain a valid Access Token.
trans-unit.target: Validates that the Web API calls contain a valid Access Token.

trans-unit.source: In order to do this, you’ll need to:
trans-unit.target: In order to do this, you’ll need to:

trans-unit.source: Register an app with Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Register an app with Azure AD

trans-unit.source: Set up your app to use the OWIN authentication pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Set up your app to use the OWIN authentication pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Configure a client app to call the To Do List Web API
trans-unit.target: Configure a client app to call the To Do List Web API

trans-unit.source: The code for this tutorial is maintained <linkText>on GitHub</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The code for this tutorial is maintained <linkText>on GitHub</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To follow along, you can <linkText>download the app's skeleton as a .zip</linkText><title></title> or clone the skeleton:
trans-unit.target: To follow along, you can <linkText>download the app's skeleton as a .zip</linkText><title></title> or clone the skeleton:

trans-unit.source: PM> Install-Package Microsoft.Owin.Security.OAuth -ProjectName TodoListService PM> Install-Package Microsoft.Owin.Security.Jwt -ProjectName TodoListService PM> Install-Package Microsoft.Owin.Host.SystemWeb -ProjectName TodoListService
trans-unit.target: PM> Install-Package Microsoft.Owin.Security.OAuth -ProjectName TodoListService PM> Install-Package Microsoft.Owin.Security.Jwt -ProjectName TodoListService PM> Install-Package Microsoft.Owin.Host.SystemWeb -ProjectName TodoListService

trans-unit.source: Open the file App_Start\Startup.Auth.cs and implement the ConfigureAuth(…) method, which will set up the Web API to accept tokens from the v2.0 endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Open the file App_Start\Startup.Auth.cs and implement the ConfigureAuth(…) method, which will set up the Web API to accept tokens from the v2.0 endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Now you can use [Authorize] attributes to protect your controllers and actions with OAuth 2.0 bearer authentication.
trans-unit.target: Now you can use [Authorize] attributes to protect your controllers and actions with OAuth 2.0 bearer authentication.

trans-unit.source: Decorate the Controllers\TodoListController.cs class with an authorize tag.
trans-unit.target: Decorate the Controllers\TodoListController.cs class with an authorize tag.

trans-unit.source: This will force the user to sign in before accessing that page.
trans-unit.target: This will force the user to sign in before accessing that page.

trans-unit.source: When an authorized caller successfully invokes one of the TodoListController APIs, the action might need access to information about the caller.
trans-unit.target: When an authorized caller successfully invokes one of the TodoListController APIs, the action might need access to information about the caller.

trans-unit.source: OWIN provides access to the claims inside the bearer token via the ClaimsPrincpal object.
trans-unit.target: OWIN provides access to the claims inside the bearer token via the ClaimsPrincpal object.

trans-unit.source: Finally, open the web.config file in the root of the TodoListService project, and enter your configuration values in the section.
trans-unit.target: Finally, open the web.config file in the root of the TodoListService project, and enter your configuration values in the section.

trans-unit.source: Your ida:Audience is the Application Id of the app that you entered in the portal.
trans-unit.target: Your ida:Audience is the Application Id of the app that you entered in the portal.

trans-unit.source: Before you can see the Todo List Service in action, you need to configure the Todo List Client so it can get tokens from the v2.0 endpoint and make calls to the service.
trans-unit.target: Before you can see the Todo List Service in action, you need to configure the Todo List Client so it can get tokens from the v2.0 endpoint and make calls to the service.

trans-unit.source: In the TodoListClient project, open App.config and enter your configuration values in the section.
trans-unit.target: In the TodoListClient project, open App.config and enter your configuration values in the section.

trans-unit.source: Your ida:ClientId Application Id you copied from the portal.
trans-unit.target: Your ida:ClientId Application Id you copied from the portal.

trans-unit.source: The ida:RedirectUri is the Redirect Uri from the portal.
trans-unit.target: The ida:RedirectUri is the Redirect Uri from the portal.

trans-unit.source: Finally, clean, build and run each project!
trans-unit.target: Finally, clean, build and run each project!

trans-unit.source: You now have a .NET MVC Web API that accepts tokens from both personal Microsoft accounts and work or school accounts.
trans-unit.target: You now have a .NET MVC Web API that accepts tokens from both personal Microsoft accounts and work or school accounts.

trans-unit.source: Sign into the TodoListClient, and call your web api to add tasks to the user's To-Do list.
trans-unit.target: Sign into the TodoListClient, and call your web api to add tasks to the user's To-Do list.

trans-unit.source: For reference, the completed sample (without your configuration values) <linkText>is provided as a .zip here</linkText><title></title>, or you can clone it from GitHub:
trans-unit.target: For reference, the completed sample (without your configuration values) <linkText>is provided as a .zip here</linkText><title></title>, or you can clone it from GitHub:

trans-unit.source: git clone --branch complete https://github.com/AzureADQuickStarts/AppModelv2-WebAPI-DotNet.git
trans-unit.target: git clone --branch complete https://github.com/AzureADQuickStarts/AppModelv2-WebAPI-DotNet.git

trans-unit.source: You can now move onto additional topics.
trans-unit.target: You can now move onto additional topics.

trans-unit.source: You may want to try:
trans-unit.target: You may want to try:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Calling a Web API from a Web App with the v2.0 app model >></linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Calling a Web API from a Web App with the v2.0 app model >></linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: For additional resources, check out:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>The App Model v2.0 Preview >></linkText><title></title>
